Entire Month June

National Rose Month

June is National Rose Month. With over 150 different species throughout North America, roses are in peak bloom in June. They are a hardy plant that can be added to any landscape. #NationalRoseMonth 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Landscaping really kicks it up a notch as gardens come in full bloom. Consider educating followers on the care and keeping of different varieties of roses.
üíê
June 1-7

National Garden Week

National Garden Week takes place the first full week in June every year. Gardens provide fresh fruits and vegetables, beautify neighborhoods and communities and provide social and physical activities throughout the year. #NationalGardenWeek Learn more ¬ª

  • Posting Recommendation
    When posting about National Garden Week, consider the hard work many people put into their gardens last year and how they can continue the upkeep this season. Consumers may celebrate with an update to their home's landscaping or much-needed maintenance.

Outdoor Living Upgrade

Getting ready for poolside dinners and days spent outside is the perfect opportunity to refresh outdoor living spaces ‚Äî that's where our outdoor lighting customers come in. Seasonal

Tricky Trees

After a season of winter weather and storms, folks begin to realize problem areas in their own backyard. Trees leaning dangerously close to the house, trees that have fallen over the last few months, or tree that need to be trimmed to keep residents safe are all top mind for new and tenured home owners. Learn more ¬ª

Common Terms & Phrases

Common Early Spring Weeds

Dandelions, White or Dutch Clover, Hairy Bittercress 

Hardscape Elements

Walkways, Driveways, Patios, Swimming pools, Sprinkler systems, Fountains, Stone benches, Gates, Flagstone and other rocks, Arbors 

Softscape Elements

Grass, Trees, Shrubs, Flowers, Soil, Vegetable gardens
